title: Cryptomiles1
author: Cryptomiles1
content: Hello ðŸ‘‹Okay, presently I want to ask why the sudden panicking around the media and forum here.I could ones remembered when bitcoin was +$69k and everyone seems to be panicking for the price to get 32k or below. Today we have another chance to buy very low yet people still waiting for the price to drop even more lower.I want to know when is the best time to buy or waiting more dip to buy and what if the price turns back to bull?What do we do?

comments.author: Majestic-milf
comments.body: I don't think there is a suitable time to buy. Looking for a dip will take one a long time because at present, the market is also volatile. The best thing to do is buy now and hodl regardless of the market trend because even if it falls deeper, one buys more. We are expecting a bull run in 2023-24 during the next BTC halving.

comments.author: NeuroticFish
comments.body: Quote from: Cryptomiles1 on May 09, 2022, 11:59:58 AMOkay, presently I want to ask why the sudden panicking around the media and forum here.There are always moonboys showing up when the price grows and doomsday preachers when the price falls.And the media always tries to squeeze stories from price movements, no matter the direction.While the price looks bad, in other similar 4-year-cycles, at this stage may have been much worse.The only thing is that with so rich institutional investors around and with so many telling "this time it'll be different", this drop came somewhat unexpected to many.Quote from: Cryptomiles1 on May 09, 2022, 11:59:58 AMI want to know when is the best time to buy or waiting more dip to buy and what if the price turns back to bull?What do we do?I can't tell how will this go on. I also thought it's different this time and at least no longer go this low.What I can tell that it's usually no bad time and no good time to buy bitcoin. Best may be to DCA. (However, please do with your money as you decide.)

comments.body: Bitcoin dropped drastically for those who are waiting to buy bitcoin at a low price this is a great opportunity to buy bitcoin because the bitcoin price has dropped 50% from the highest price, can also wait in the next few days maybe the bitcoin price will go down again I see this may be repeated like in 2018 .

comments.author: StanCrypt
comments.body: Quote from: Cryptomiles1 on May 09, 2022, 11:59:58 AMI want to know when is the best time to buy or waiting more dip to buy and what if the price turns back to bull?What do we do?Cryptocurrency is a very volatile asset class with many ups and downs. As a result, many people believe they should try to plan their investments by purchasing within specified windows in order to acquire the best price.Everything in crypto is always evolving. If you're trying to time your purchases, this could be an issue. For the term, though, i think the ideal time to buy is near the end of the month. From my observations, the first ten days of the month, the prices usually experience a rise, followed by a price drop (due to people selling after price hikes) in the second half of the month. You can also acquire Bitcoin and hold it for a long time if you want to make a bigger profit. As more individuals purchase and utilize Bitcoin, the value and purchasing power of the BitCoin you purchase today may increase. Keeping your Bitcoin is also a good idea if you bought it while the price was quite high. Not only will you avoid losing money, but you might even make money in the long run. The value of Bitcoin will, of course, fluctuate. If you follow the market, your purchasing power will increase rather than decrease as a result of inflation.

comments.author: uelque
comments.body: I believe bitcoin would drop further to 30k or 29k dollars and maybe there we can decide whether it is the right time to buy. And yeah, most people have been waiting for this thing to happen again and I know a few people that are just waiting for this dip. Though I think there are some doubts in their mind because most of them are saying that a possible 2018 scenario might takes place again just like what most people here keeps on saying, but for me, it is still to early to decide whether it can happen or not. comments.author: maydna
comments.body: Panic? I'm not panicking to see bitcoin's price still dropping because this is a good moment to buy at this price and other lows. But I don't know if other people will do the same as me buying at a low price or if they are still waiting and hoping the price can hit their target price.I think we have the best time to buy or sell differently because the analysis we use is also different. But I guess you already know that if the price drops sharply then it could be the best time to buy but you have to analyze further to find out. If the price returns to the bull market and you bought it some time ago, then you can sell it for a profit.

comments.author: Fivestar4everMVP
comments.body: Quote from: Cryptomiles1 on May 09, 2022, 11:59:58 AMI want to know when is the best time to buy or waiting more dip to buy.  Personally, I honestly do not think there is an actual time that is the best time to buy, bitcoin market is a large market and it is not possible for everyone in the world to be buying or selling bitcoin at the same time, this is out of market characteristics, your decision and my decision to either buy or sell should be born out of yours and my research respectively, this means, you alone can decide when you want to buy or sell, and also, I alone can decide when to buy or sell, it's a personal thing, there is no general side to it. Quote and what if the price turns back to bull?What do we do?You can either FOMO in (if you are a risk taker) or sit and watch supposedly big gains pass you by, there is no two ways to it, the market does not know or respect anybody, you either learn how to flow with the market or sit and watch those who know how to while they make their money.

I would say start accumulating bitcoin in slow pace. Keep an open eye to the volatility and keep on buying in little quantities. If you have 1000 dollars to invest, break it up in 10 parts of 100 dollars each. That will average out your buying price to keep the risk low. But do not expect that the market will come back up anytime soon. So plan your investment for alteast 2 - 3 years timeframe.

comments.author: cheezcarls
comments.body: Quote from: Cryptomiles1 on May 09, 2022, 11:59:58 AMHello ðŸ‘‹Okay, presently I want to ask why the sudden panicking around the media and forum here.I could ones remembered when bitcoin was +$69k and everyone seems to be panicking for the price to get 32k or below. Today we have another chance to buy very low yet people still waiting for the price to drop even more lower.I want to know when is the best time to buy or waiting more dip to buy and what if the price turns back to bull?What do we do?There is no perfect timing for us to buy Bitcoin. It should be on our own instincts regardless of the price that it has right now. There are scenarios such as this:BTC pulled back to $34k, but you asked "Is this a good time to buy?", but you didn't. BTC pulled back to $33k, but you asked the same thing and didn't take action.BTC pulled back to $30k, but you asked the same thing and didn't take action again.BTC suddenly pumped back to $35k, and then you said "How I wish I did bought some" and regretted it.Some people are hesitant to buy when it's cheap, fearing that it might go lower and may lose even more. But the thing is no matter how skilled we are in looking at the charts, reading the candlesticks, getting updated with the trends, etc., there are no promises or guarantees about the movement of Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies out there.
